maml:description.maml:para: Load a assembly into domain
Loads a specified assembly into memory. This is permanent until you restart PowerShell. Equivivalent to loading a assembly by using reflection.
Copyright © 2013 Daniel Sörlöv
The name or path to assembly for load
Will load the assembly from a specific location (not GAC)

maml:description.maml:para: Blocks a mutex or wait for it to be free
This commandlet reserves a mutex and returns or if the mutex is already reserved it waits for it to be released.
Copyright © 2013 Daniel Sörlöv
The name of the mutex

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Block-Mutex -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Block-Mutex -full".

maml:description.maml:para: This function can be used to execute tasks in parallel.

his function can be used to execute tasks in parallel with more than 5 parallel tasks at once. The number of parallel tasks can be defined by parameter. The input is accepted by defining it by using the -InputObject parameter which also accepts input from the pipeline.
Copyright © 2013 Daniel Sörlöv
The document to convert to PDF
The document to convert to PDF

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Invoke-ParalellForeach -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Invoke-ParalellForeach -full".
